items.title: Bank of England cuts rates again, citing Trump tariff tensions and slower growth
items.description: The BoE cuts rates to 4.25%, citing tariff-driven growth fears, even as it lifts UK GDP forecasts and inflation pressures ease.

items.title: Melinda French Gates says the Gates Foundation’s commitment to spend its entire $200 billion on global health by 2045 is ‘fantastic’: ‘The vast majority of resources were to go back to society’
items.description: French Gates has played a pivotal role in global health since the turn of the century.

items.title: CFOs need a new ‘playbook’ for tariff-fueled uncertainty
items.description: The Fed's decision to hold rates steady underscores a critical reality for business leaders, according to economists.

items.title: How Lead Edge Capital’s 750-strong army of backers powers its venture flywheel
items.description: Nimay Mehta on the New York VC firm’s unique approach to software investing.

items.title: An air traffic controller at Newark is like ‘a 3D-chess player who can juggle a chainsaw’ with their eyes closed, ex-pilot says
items.description: Air traffic controllers are taking “trauma leave” to deal with stress after the chaos at Newark.
